name: Easy Leftover Meatloaf Empanadas
author: TeenChef
summary: Try this empanada recipe for a great way to use leftover meatloaf wrapped in homemade pastry.
ingredients: ½ cup cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
½ pound leftover meatloaf, or more as desired
directions: Add butter, egg, water, and vinegar
Combine, mashing with your hands, until dough is well blended and sticks together
Put meatloaf in a bowl and add chili powder, crushed bay leaves, cumin, garlic powder, and salt
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Add garlic and cook for 1 to 2 minutes
Add meatloaf and cook until hot and browned, 3 to 5 minutes
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Coat a baking sheet with nonstick spray
Flour a work surface and roll out dough
Add an equal amount of meatloaf filling to each circle
Fold dough over and use a fork to enclose and seal empanadas
Place on the prepared baking sheet
Whisk egg yolks in a bowl and brush over empanadas
Bake in the preheated oven until slightly browned, 15 to 20 minutes
